fig.title: : SH-BC-893 protects from ceramide-induced mitochondrial network fragmentation by disrupting intracellular trafficking.
fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: Citrate synthase staining in MEFs treated for 3 h with BSA or palmitate (250 μM) after a 3 h pre-treatment with DMSO (control), YM201636 (YM, 800 nM), NAV2729 (NAV, 12.5 μM) or SH-BC-893 (893, 5 μM).
ImageJ was used to calculate aspect ratio (B), branch length (C), and roundness (D) of mitochondria in the cells in (A) as described in Fig. EV1. PA, palmitate.
MEFs were treated with BSA, palmitate (250 μM), or C16:0 CER (100 μM) for 3 h after a 1 h pre-treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 (5 μM) and mitochondria stained as in (A).
aspect ratio (F), branch length (G), and roundness (H) of mitochondria in the cells in (E).

Mean C16:0 ceramide levels in MEFs pre-treated for 3 h with vehicle (n=7), SH-BC-893 (5 μM, n=7), myriocin (myr, 10 μM, n=5), or fumonisin B1 (FB1, 30 μM, n=3) then treated with BSA or palmitate (250 μM) for 3 h. Cells treated with C16:0 CER (100 μM, n=2) for 3 h shown as a positive control. Error bars, SEM.
MEFs treated as in (A) but evaluated for DRP1 (red) and citrate synthase (green) co-localization (yellow) using confocal immunofluorescence microscopy. Nuclei are labeled with DAPI (blue).

Mander's overlap coefficient for DRP1 and citrate synthase (CS) for the cells in (J) calculated on a per cell basis. Representative DRP1 western blot (L) or quantification of DRP1 levels (M) using cells treated as in (J); n=3. Mean ± SD.

MEFs expressing vector, TRPML-1, or GRP1-DD were treated with BSA or palmitate (250 μM) for 3 h and stained as in (A). aspect ratio (O), branch length (P), and roundness (Q) of mitochondria in the cells in (N).

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 protects from ceramide-induced mitochondrial dysfunction.
fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: TMRE (100 nM) and MitoTracker green (200 nM) staining in MEFs treated with BSA or palmitate (250 μM) for 12 h after a 3 h pre-treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 (893, 5 μM). TMRE intensity in (A) on a per cell basis. MitoSOX (5 μM) and MitoTracker Green (200 nM) staining in MEFs treated with vehicle (DMSO) or C2-ceramide (50 μM) for 12 h after a 3 h pre-treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 (893, 5 μM). MitoSOX intensity for (C) on a per cell basis.
Chop, Xbp1s, Atf6, and Grp78 mRNA levels measured in MEFs treated for 16 h with BSA or palmitate (250 μM) after a 3 h pre-treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 (893, 5 μM); n=3. Mean ± SEM.

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 acutely restores a tubular mitochondrial network in the liver and brain of HFD-fed mice.
fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: Body weights of mice that had consumed a SD for 22 weeks or a HFD for 26 weeks; n=4-5. Mean ± SD. Mice are grouped to reflect their randomization to vehicle or SH-BC-893 groups, weight measured prior to treatment.

NAD(P) H autofluorescence evaluated by confocal microscopy in freshly resected livers from mice in (A) 4-8 h after treatment with vehicle (n=5) or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 (n=4) by gavage at ZT8.5. Mice were sacrificed and imaged in pairs (SD and HFD).
Aspect ratio (C) and roundness (D) of mitochondria in the livers shown in (B) calculated per field as described in Fig. EV3; 40 fields examined from each treatment group.

Body weights of mice that had consumed a chow or HFD diet for 22 weeks; n=3. Mean ± SD. Mice are grouped to reflect their randomization to vehicle or SH-BC-893 groups, weight measured prior to treatment.
Coronal brain section showing the areas where mitochondria were imaged in G-L.
Citrate synthase staining in the arcuate nucleus of mice in (E) 4 h after treatment with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 by gavage at ZT8.5; n=3.
Aspect ratio (H) or roundness (I) of the mitochondria in (G); 18 fields examined from each treatment group.
imaging was performed in the areas of the cortex
As in G-I but imaging was performed in the areas of the cortex outlined in (F). 18 fields examined from each treatment group.

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 preserves mitochondrial function in the WAT of mice with HFD-induced obesity.
fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: Body weight of mice fed the SD or HFD for 16 weeks; n=5. Mice are grouped to reflect their randomization to vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 groups, weight measured prior to treatment.

NAD(P) H autofluorescence was evaluated in epididymal fat (eWAT) freshly resected from the mice in (A) 4 h after treatment with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 by gavage at ZT8.5; n=5. NAD(P) H intensity from (B) calculated on a per cell basis; 16 - 25 cells from each of the 5 mice per group were quantified (87 - 109 total cells per treatment group).
Body weight of mice fed the SD or HFD for 16 weeks; n=5. Mice are grouped to reflect their randomization to vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 groups, weight measured prior to treatment.

TMRE (100 nM) and MitoTracker Green staining (200 nM) in eWAT resected from mice in (D) treated as in (B,C); n=5. TMRE (F) or MitoTracker (G) intensity for (E) calculated on a per cell basis; 15 - 24 cells from each of the 5 mice in each group were quantified (99 - 104 total cells per treatment group).

MitoSOX (5 μM) and MitoTracker Green staining in eWAT resected from the mice in (D) treated as in (B and E); n=5. MitoSOX (I) or MitoTracker (J) intensity calculated as in (F and G); 10 - 13 cells from each of the 5 mice in each group were quantified (57 - 58 total cells per treatment group).

Chop, Xbp1s, Atf6, and Grp78 mRNA measured in eWAT resected from mice maintained on a HFD for 13 weeks and gavaged with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for the final 3 weeks; n=7-9.

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 normalizes adipokine levels in mice consuming a HFD.
fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: Plasma adiponectin (A) or leptin (B) in mice maintained on a SD or HFD for 8-9 weeks then gavaged with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 4 h prior to blood collection. Pair-fed mice were provided with the amount of food consumed by SH-BC-893-treated mice in 4 h but left untreated; n=8-10.
The adiponectin:leptin ratio was calculated for the mice in A,B.

As in (A,B) but in mice maintained on the HFD for 10 weeks and then gavaged Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays for 3 weeks with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893; n=9. Rx, treatment number of a total of nine doses.
The adiponectin:leptin ratio was calculated for the mice in (D,E); n=9.
Mice were treated as in D-F, sacrificed 4 h after the ninth dose, and the levels of Socs3 (G) or Lepr (H) mRNA measured in the hypothalamus; n=8.
Body weights of mice fed the HFD for the indicated interval. Two cohorts were utilized, one measured at 4 and 8 wk and the other at 10 and 16 wk; n=16-20.
Plasma adiponectin and leptin were measured in the mice in (I) 4 h after a single dose of 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893; n=7-10.
The adiponectin:leptin ratio was calculated for the mice in J,K; n=7-10.

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 reduces food intake and triggers weight loss.
fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: Food intake during indirect calorimetry studies in mice fed the HFD for 10-12 weeks and then gavaged with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 at ZT8.5 on days 1 (first exposure) and 3; n=5-8. The means of 4 measurements over 108 minutes (A) or over the dark cycle (ZT12-ZT24) (B) shown ± SEM. In (A), arrows indicate dosing. Grey shading indicates dark period.
as in (A,B) but measuring the respiratory exchange ratio (RER); n=6-8.

Average RER from ZT12-ZT24 in mice fed the HFD for 22 weeks then treated once at ZT8.5 with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893; n=7-8. Pair-fed mice were fed the amount of food eaten by SH-BC-893-treated animals.

Absolute (F) or relative (G) body weight of mice fed the standard diet and gavaged with vehicle (SD, n=10) or a HFD and gavaged with vehicle (n=10), 60 mg/kg (n=9), or 120 mg/kg (n=10) SH-BC-893 on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays beginning on day 47 (arrow in F).
Fat (H,I) or lean (J,K) mass in the mice in (F) measured after the 4 weeks of treatment (H,J) or weekly (I,K); n=9-10.
Average daily distance run by HFD-fed mice treated with vehicle (n=8) or SH-BC-893 (120 mg/kg, n=6) on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays over 4 weeks when housed with a running wheel.
Body weight of mice fed the SD or HFD housed with or without wheels and treated with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 as indicated over time (M) or after 4 weeks of treatment (N); n=6-10.

Mice were fed chow or the HFD for 9-10 weeks then treated with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays for 3 weeks; n=9. Mean absolute (O) or relative (P) caloric intake per mouse in the 24 h after treatment is plotted for each of 8 different treatments; mice were euthanized 4 h after the ninth treatment.
Body weight change in the mice in (O,P) over the 24 h after the first treatment (Q) or after the 3 week course of treatment (R); n=9.

fig.title: : SH-BC-893 corrects metabolic dysfunction associated with HFD-induced obesity.
fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: Representative H&E stained liver sections from the mice shown in Fig. 6F after 4 weeks of treatment with vehicle or 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893. Scale bar, 10 μm.

Unbiased lipidomics performed on the livers of 4 randomly selected mice from Fig. 6F. Lipids that were significantly different in SD, HFD + vehicle, or HFD + 120 mg/kg SH-BC-893 shown. PG, phosphatidylglycerol; PE, phosphatidylethanolamine; PC, phosphatidylcholine; Cer, ceramide; TAG, triacylglycerol; and LPC, lysophosphatidylcholine.
Ceramide levels in livers of the same mice as in (B); n=4.
Total triacylglycerol (TAG) levels in livers of the same mice as in (B); n=4. Fasting blood glucose from mice randomly selected from the cohorts in Fig. 6F after 25 d of treatment; n=4-6.
Blood glucose levels (F) or area under the curve (AUC, (G)) during an oral glucose tolerance test performed in the same mice as in (E).

Insulin levels in plasma collected 4 h after the indicated treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 from the mice in Fig. 5D,E or in 9 week old SD-fed mice treated with vehicle (same mice as in Fig. 5J,K, 0 weeks on HFD); n=8. Insulin levels in the plasma collected 4 h after treatment with vehicle or SH-BC-893 from the same mice as in Fig. 5A,B; n=8.
